variable_description: Census divisions
variable_definition: Census divisions of the U.S., include Pacific, Mountain, West North Central, West South Central, East North Central, East South Central, Middle Atlantic, South Atlantic, New England

variable_description: Census regions
variable_definition: Census regions of the U.S., include West, Midwest, South, Northeast

variable_description: County-level code that identifies the county and state where an operation is located
variable_definition: Codes which uniquely identify U.S. counties. County-level FIPS codes have five digits of which the first two are the FIPS code of the state to which the county belongs

variable_description: Counties in metro areas of 1 million population or more, counties in metro areas of 250,000 to 1 million population, or counties in metro areas of fewer than 250,000 population
variable_definition: Rural-urban continuum codes 1, 2, and 3

variable_description: Urban population of 20,000 or more, adjacent to a metro area, urban population of 5,000 to 20,000, adjacent to a metro area, urban population of fewer than 5,000, adjacent to a metro area
variable_definition: Rural-urban continuum codes 4, 6, and 8

variable_description: Urban population of 20,000 or more, not adjacent to a metro area, urban population of 5,000 to 20,000, not adjacent to a metro area, urban population of fewer than 5,000, not adjacent to a metro area
variable_definition: Rural-urban continuum codes 5, 7, and 9

variable_description: Rural-urban continuum codes (1 - Metro, 9 - nonmetro
variable_definition: 2013 Rural-urban continuum codes, raning from 1: Metro - Counties in metro areas of 1 million population or more to 9: Nonmetro - Urban population of fewer than 5,000, not adjacent to a metro area

variable_description: Operation that produced organic products
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Operation that has USDA NOP certified organic production
variable_definition: National Organic Program (NOP)

variable_description: Operations that has USDA NOP organic production exempt from certification
variable_definition: National Organic Program (NOP)

variable_description: Operation has production according to USDA NOP standards but not certified or exempt
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Gross value of sales of certified or exempt organic products
variable_definition: Includes the gross value of USDA NOP certified or exempt organically produced commodities sold from this operation

variable_description: Organic sales as a percent of total sales
variable_definition: equal to zero when total sales are zero

variable_description: Operation has acres transitioning into USDA NOP organic production
variable_definition: National Organic Program (NOP)

variable_description: Organic sales for only those producers with positive organic sales
variable_definition: NA for operations without organic sales, and a positive number for those with organic sales

variable_description: Organic sales as a percent of total sales for those producers with organic sales
variable_definition: Organic sales

variable_description: Operations with commodity sales only
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Operations with direct-to-consumer sales
variable_definition: Dummy variable where 1 indicates an operation has direct-to-consumer sales and 0 it does not (they could also have intermediated sales, not an exclusive category)

variable_description: Local food operations with both direct-to-consumer and intermediated sales
variable_definition: Variable is exclusive within operations with local food sales, operations have sales through both direct and intermediated market channels

variable_description: Local food operations with direct-to-consumer sales only
variable_definition: Variable is exclusive within operations with local food sales, operations do not have sales through intermediated channels

variable_description: Direct-to-consumer sales
Direct-to-consumer sales as a percent of total sales
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Operations with intermediated sales
variable_definition: Dummy variable where 1 indicates an operation has intermediated sales and 0 it does not (they could also have direct-to-consumer sales, not an exclusive category)

variable_description: Local food operations with intermediated sales only
variable_definition: Variable is exclusive within operations with local food sales, operations do not have sales through direct-to-consumer channels

variable_description: Intermediated sales
Intermediated sales as a percent of total sales
variable_definition: Truncated at 1 if intermediated sales are greater than 1 (less than 1% of obs.), 0 if tvp==0

variable_description: Operations with local and commodity sales
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Operations with local food sales
variable_definition: Dummy variable where 1 indicates an operation has local sales and 0 it does not (they could also have nonlocal sales, not an exclusive category)

variable_description: Local food sales factor variable with two levels: Local, Commodity only
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Operations with all sales coming from local food marketing channels, they have no sales through commodity market channels
variable_definition: This is an exclusive category and can be useful when wanting to attribute metrics at the whole farm level to local producers

variable_description: Local only factor variable with 3 levels: Local sales only, Commodity sales only, Local and commodity sales
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Local food sales
variable_definition: d2c_sales + intermediated_sales

variable_description: Local sales as a percent of total sales
variable_definition: Truncated at 1 if local sales are greater than 1 (less than 1% of obs.), 0 if tvp==0

variable_description: Market channel factor variable with four levels: Direct-to-consumer only, Intermediated only, Direct and intermediated, No local food sales
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Operations with positive direct-to-consumer sales
variable_definition: Useful when calculating statistics to understand information about only those that participate

variable_description: Operations with positive intermediated sales
variable_definition: Useful when calculating statistics to understand information about only those that participate

variable_description: Operations with positive local food sales
variable_definition: Useful when calculating statistics to understand information about only those that participate

variable_description: Operations with agritourism income
variable_definition: Agritourism includes agri-tourism and recreational services such as farm tours, hay rides, hunting, fishing, etc.

variable_description: Income from agritourism activities
variable_definition: Agritourism includes agri-tourism and recreational services such as farm tours, hay rides, hunting, fishing, etc.

variable_description: Agritourism income as a percent of total sales
variable_definition: Agritourism is income that is calculated separtely from total sales, so this percentage can be over 100

variable_description: An operation with local, organic, or value-added sales or agritourism income
variable_definition: In 2007 and 2012 only includes sales from direct-to-consumer and does not include value-added sales

variable_description: Total sales from local, organic, or value-added and income from agritourism
variable_definition: In 2007 and 2012 only includes sales from direct-to-consumer and does not include value-added sales

variable_description: Value-added sales as a percent of total sales
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Operations with value-added sales
variable_definition: Processed or value-added products include jam, wine, cheese, meat, floral arrangements, cider, etc. (includes sales through both local and commodity market channels)

variable_description: A value-added factor variable with two levels: Value-added sales and no value-added sales
variable_definition: NA

variable_description: Sales from value-added or processed products
variable_definition: Processed or value-added products include jam, wine, cheese, meat, floral arrangements, cider, etc. (includes sales through both local and commodity market channels)

variable_description: Total assets: all land and buildings owned, rented or leased from others, machinery, equipment, and implements, minus land and buildings leased from others
Acres covered under crop insurance as a percent of all acres operated
Total expense: contractor total production expenses + operator and landlord total production expeneses
Operation owns all of the land they operate
Operation rents all of the land they operate
Gross cash farm income (GCFI): total sales + contract income + government payments + income from ag related sources - landlord's share of  total sales
Government payments as a share of total value of production, shows the importance of government payments to the farm business
variable_definition:
When gcfi==0, then 0, otherwise
      k684/gcfi

variable_description: Total government payments received, including CRP, WRP, FWP, CREP, and other Federal agricultural program payments)
Operations that recieve government payments
variable_definition: when gov_payments>0 then 1, otherwise 0

variable_description: Net farm income (GCFI minus total expenses)
variable_definition: gcfi - exp

variable_description: Total interest expense as a share of total acres
Total interest expense as a share of total assets
variable_definition: (k1515 + k1516)/assets

variable_description: Operating expense ratio, measures the amount of cash the farm sector spends to generate a dollar of production
variable_definition: If gcfi equals zero then  NA, otherwise equals (exp - k1513 - k1515)/gcfi

variable_description: A value of one means the operating expense ratio is greater than 0.8, zero otherwise
variable_definition: If the operating expense ratio >0.8 then 1, otherwise 0

variable_description: Operating profit margin: measures funds available to finance the farm's ongoing operation
variable_definition: gcfi - exp + k1513 + k1515)/gcfi. Note: we cannot deduct the estimated market value of the unpaid labor and management services provided by the farm household as they do using ARMS.

variable_description: A value of one means the operating profit margin is less than 0.1, zero otherwise
variable_definition: If OPM<0.1 then 1, otherwise 0

variable_description: Operating profit margin zones: High risk (OPM < 0.10), Medium risk (OPM >= 0.10 & OPM <= 0.25), Low risk (OPM >0.2)
variable_definition: If OPM< 0.10 then High risk, if OPM >= 0.10 & opm <= 0.25 then Medium risk, if OPM >0.25 then Low risk

variable_description: Ratio of owned acres to operated acres
A value of one means operations owns at least 50% of the land they operate, a value of zero means they do not
variable_definition: if owned_operated >=0.5, then 1, otherwise 0

variable_description: A value of one means operation owns part of the land they operate, zero means they either own or rent all of their land
A value of 1 means the operation has positive profit, zero means they do not
variable_definition: If (gcfi - exp) > 0, then 1, otherwise 0

variable_description: Share of operated land that is rented in
variable_definition: rlif/k46

variable_description: Return on assets (ROA): measures the returns to farm sector assets from current farm operations
A value of one means the operation has a return on assets less than 0.01, zero otherwise
variable_definition: If roa<0.01, then 1, otherwise 0,

variable_description: Three levels: Full owner, Part owner and Full tenant
variable_definition: When k43 >= k46 then Full owner, when k43 >0 & k43 < k46 then Part owner and when k43 == 0 then Full tenant

variable_description: Total sales (both under production contract and not under production contract)
variable_definition: k1347 (sales not under production contract) + k1367 (total sales under production contract)

variable_description: Scale factor variable with 8 categories based on acres operated: 1 to 9, 10 to 50, 50 to 179, 180 to 499, 500 to 999, 1,000 to 1,999, 2,000 or more
Primary commodity: livestock and dairy
variable_definition: If livestock==1, dairy==1, poultry==1, or otheranimal==1, then 1, otherwise 0

variable_description: Primary commodity: crops
variable_definition: If fieldcrop==1, fruitveg==1, or othercrops==1, then 1, otherwise 0

variable_description: Dairy operation with acres insured under Federal crop insurance
variable_definition: If dairy ==1, then crop_insurance, otherwise NA

variable_description: Field crop operation with acres insured under Federal crop insurance
variable_definition: If fieldcrop ==1, then crop_insurance, otherwise NA

variable_description: Fruit/vegetable operation with acres insured under Federal crop insurance
variable_definition: If fruitveg==1, then crop_insurance, otherwise NA

variable_description: Livestock operation with acres insured under Federal crop insurance
variable_definition: If livestock ==1, then crop_insurance, otherwise NA

variable_description: Other animal operation with acres insured under Federal crop insurance
variable_definition: If otheranimal==1, then crop_insurance, otherwise NA

variable_description: Other crop operation with acres insured under Federal crop insurance
variable_definition: If othercrops ==1, then crop_insurance, otherwise NA

variable_description: Poultry operation with acres insured under Federal crop insurance
variable_definition: If poultry ==1, then crop_insurance, otherwise NA

variable_description: Crop insurance by primary commodity factor variable where each factor indicates an operation has a specific primary commodity and Federal crop insurance: Field crop, Fruit/veg, Other crops, Livestock, Dairy, Poultry, Other animal
variable_definition: Factor variable: crop_ins_fieldcrop==1 then Field crop, crop_ins_fruitveg==1 then Fruit/veg crop_ins_othercrops==1 then Other crops, crop_ins_livestock==1 then Livestock, crop_ins_dairy ==1 then Dairy, crop_ins_poultry ==1 then Poultry, crop_ins_otheranimal == 1 then Other animal, otherwise then no crop insurance

variable_description: Operation has crop acres insured under Federal crop insurance
variable_definition: If k1067>0, then 1, otherwise 0

variable_definition: If farmtype==10, then 1, otherwise 0

variable_definition: If farmtype==4 or 5, then 1, otherwise 0

variable_definition: If sales_class== $0 to $74,999 then 1, otherwise 0

variable_definition: If sales_class==$350,000 to $999,999 then 1, otherwise 0

variable_description: Primary commodity with 7 factors: Field crop, Fruit/Veg, Other crops, Livestock, Dairy, Poultry, Other animal
variable_definition: A primary commodity accounts for 50 percent or more of an operation’s total value of production. For diversified operations, where no one commodity makes up 50 percent or more of the total values of production, NASS uses an algorithm to assign the operation a primary commodity. In most cases, diversified crop operations are classified as other crop and diversified livestock operations are classified as other animal

variable_definition: Majority off-farm is defined as an operator spending 50% or more of his/her worktime on work other than farming or ranching

variable_definition: Majority off-farm is defined as an operator spending 50% or more of his/her worktime on work other than farming or ranching

variable_definition: Majority off-farm is defined as an operator spending 50% or more of his/her worktime on work other than farming or ranching

variable_description: Off-farm work factor variable with three levels: All operators work majority off-farm, One or more but not all operators work majority off-farm, No operators work majority off-far
variable_definition: Majority off-farm is defined as an operator spending 50% or more of his/her worktime on work other than farming or ranching

variable_description: Number of days worked off-farm by primary operator (1:none, 2:1-49 days, 3:50-99 days, 4:100-199 days, 5:200 days or more)
variable_definition: Days off-farm include days in which the operator worked at least four hours per day in an off-farm job, including work on someone else's farm for pay, data not available for 2017

variable_description: Primary operator works majority off-farm
variable_definition: Majority off-farm is defined as an operator spending 50% or more of his/her worktime on work other than farming or ranching, data is not available in 2017

variable_description: Average days worked off-farm for all operators on an operation
variable_definition: Days off-farm include days in which the operator worked at least four hours per day in an off-farm job, including work on someone else's farm for pay. Each operator indicates a number from 1-5 and here we sum up those numbers and divide them by the number of operators on the operation

variable_description: Proportion of operators on an operation that work majority off-farm
variable_definition: Total number of operators working majority off-farm/total number of operators

variable_description: Total number of days worked off-farm by all operators on an operation (1:none, 2:1-49 days, 3:50-99 days, 4:100-199 days, 5:200 days or more)
variable_definition: Days off-farm include days in which the operator worked at least four hours per day in an off-farm job, including work on someone else's farm for pay. Each operator indicates a number from 1-5 and here we sum up those numbers

variable_description: Total number of operators on an operation working primarily off-farm
variable_definition: Majority off-farm is defined as an operator spending 50% or more of his/her worktime on work other than farming or ranching

variable_description: An operation with acres planted as a cover crop
variable_definition: A cover crop is a crop planted primarily to manage soil erosion, soil fertility, soil quality, water, weeds, pests, and diseases on non-CRP acres

variable_description: Acres planted with a cover crop
variable_definition: A cover crop is a crop planted primarily to manage soil erosion, soil fertility, soil quality, water, weeds, pests, and diseases on non-CRP acres

variable_description: An operation where intensive-till farming practices were utilized
variable_definition: Intensive tillage leaves less than 15% of crop residue of small grain residue. This type of tillage is often referred to as conventional tillage. Intensive tillage often involves multiple operations with implements such as a mold board, disk, and/or chisel plow

variable_description: Acres where intensive-till farming practices were utilized
variable_definition: Intensive tillage leaves less than 15% of crop residue of small grain residue. This type of tillage is often referred to as conventional tillage. Intensive tillage often involves multiple operations with implements such as a mold board, disk, and/or chisel plow

variable_description: An operation where no-till farming practices were utilized
variable_definition: No-till farming practices is cropland used for production from year to year without disturbing the soil through tillage other than planting

variable_description: Acres where no-till farming practices were utilized
variable_definition: No-till farming practices is cropland used for production from year to year without disturbing the soil through tillage other than planting

variable_description: An operation where reduced-till farming practices were utilized
variable_definition: Reduced tillage leaves between 15% and 30% residue cover on the soil of small grain residue to conserve moisture and prevent erosion. This may involve the use of a chisel plow, field cultivators, or other implements

variable_description: Acres where reduced-till farming practices were utilized
